sprouts.impl

Class AbstractVariable<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • sprouts.impl.AbstractVariable<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the value wrapped by a given property...
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Val<T>, Var<T>

    public abstract class AbstractVariable<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Var<T>
    The base implementation for both Var and Val interfaces. This also serves as a reference implementation for the concept of Var/Val properties in general.

      • withId

        public Var<T> withId(java.lang.String id)
        Use this method to create a new property with an id. This id is used to identify the property in the UI or as a key in a map, which is useful when converting your view model to a JSON object, or similar formats.
        Specified by:
        withId in interface Val<T>
        Specified by:
        withId in interface Var<T>
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the property.
        Returns:
        A new Var instance with the given id.

      • onAct

        public Var<T> onAct(Action<Val<T>> action)
        Use this method to add an action to this property which is supposed to be triggered when the UI changes the item of this property through the Var::act(T) method, or simply when it is explicitly triggered by the Var::act(T) method.
        Specified by:
        onAct in interface Var<T>
        Parameters:
        action - The action to be triggered when Var::act(T) or Var::fireAct() is called.
        Returns:
        This very property instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • fireAct

        public Var<T> fireAct()
        Triggers the action associated with this property, if one was set using Var.onAct(Action). This method is intended to be used in the UI to indicate that the user has changed the item of the property not your view model.
        Specified by:
        fireAct in interface Var<T>
        Returns:
        This very wrapper instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • act

        public Var<T> act(T newValue)
        Updates the state of this property and then, if the state has changed, trigger its action using the Var.fireAct() method but not the Val.fireSet().
        This method is intended to be used in the UI. If you want to modify the state of the property from the view model, as part of your business logic, you should use the Var::set(T) method instead.
        Specified by:
        act in interface Var<T>
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new item which ought to replace the old one.
        Returns:
        This very wrapper instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • set

        public Var<T> set(T newItem)
        This method provides the ability to change the state of the wrapper. It might have several side effects depending on the implementation.
        Specified by:
        set in interface Var<T>
        Parameters:
        newItem - The new item which ought to replace the old one.
        Returns:
        This very wrapper instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • viewAs

        public final <U> Val<U> viewAs(java.lang.Class<U> type,
                               java.util.function.Function<T,U> mapper)
        Use this to create a live view of this property through a new property based on the provided mapping function.
        Specified by:
        viewAs in interface Val<T>
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the item returned from the mapping function
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the item returned from the mapping function
        mapper - the mapping function to apply to an item, if present
        Returns:

      • type

        public final java.lang.Class<T> type()

        public final java.lang.String id()

        id in interface Val<T>
        Returns:

      • onSet

        public Val<T> onSet(Action<Val<T>> displayAction)
        Use this to register an observer lambda which will be called whenever the item wrapped by this Val changes through the Var::set(T) method. The lambda will receive the current item of this property.
        Specified by:
        onSet in interface Val<T>
        Parameters:
        displayAction - The lambda which will be called whenever the item wrapped by this Var changes.
        Returns:
        The Val instance itself.

      • fireSet

        public Val<T> fireSet()
        Triggers the observer lambdas registered through the Val.onSet(Action) method. This method is called automatically by the Var::set(T) method, and it is supposed to be used by the UI to update the UI components. This is in essence how binding works in Swing-Tree.
        Specified by:
        fireSet in interface Val<T>
        Returns:
        The Val instance itself.
